Feeling the crew’s questioning looks, he faces them. Then, with a slight nod, he gives the horrifying answer. On the monitors, Jim McKay is discussing with Jennings, but

scenes.heading: INT. HALLWAY - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: The show is over. Geoff watches the crew members leave the building, dejected. He looks through the storage room window to see two worn faces: Hank and Carter unloading equipment, drawn from their mission at the airport. He walks to the room, stops in the doorway.

scenes.heading: INT. STORAGE ROOM - NIGHT

dialogues.text: Marianne, I’m sorry I sent you out there. I can only imagine the things you saw.
I saw nothing. I was there with hundreds of people.
Geoff, Roone would like a word.

scenes.actionPreview: Geoff notices Marianne at the Steenbeck. She’s packing up her typewriter. Marianne looks at Geoff, her gaze reveals how deeply shaken she is. Germany. Again. And we failed. Germany failed. McKAY (CONT’D) (MORE) 104. We stared into the night. We were waiting for something to happen, because we wanted

scenes.heading: INT. ROONE’S OFFICE - NIGHT

dialogues.text: There will be a commemoration at the stadium. Tomorrow at 10 am. I got us the bird. Jim and Jennings will anchor. (beat)
I know it doesn't feel like it, but you did a hell of a job today.
But... But it was a catastrophe.
Roone, I wanted to talk to you about an hour-long special for tomorrow. I have a few approaches.
I’d take a flash unit out to the airport to see the place in daylight. The helicopters will certainly still be there. At least what is left of them....

scenes.actionPreview: Geoff enters. Roone’s on the phone. Hold on one second. Roone puts his hand on the receiver, hands Geoff a wire. And you’ll be in charge. Geoff has no idea how to deal with that. He is completely perplexed. Roone notices. Wants to clear things up. 106. Geoff is stunned. Doesn’t know how to respond.

scenes.heading: INT. CONTROL ROOM - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Geoff grabs his jacket. About to go when he pauses. Looks back. The room’s completely empty now. Like a ghost town. Pieces of paper scattered on the floor. Half-empty coffee mugs everywhere. One screen still flashes, showing ABC NY’s live late night programming. On the wall the pictures of the Israe

scenes.heading: EXT. PARKING LOT - DAWN
scenes.actionPreview: The front door opens. Geoff steps outside for the first time on this long journey. Almost 24 hours later. The night is clear like yesterday. But the world is different. Geoff heads toward the parked cars. 106. 107.

scenes.heading: INT. RENTAL CAR - DAWN
scenes.actionPreview: Geoff drops into the driver’s seat. He closes his eyes. Needs to.
